name: test-data-improvements
goal: Improve Aret√© test data so it exercises real end-product workflows and provides shared realistic fixtures for automated tests.

userStories.title: Lock scope and success criteria (product-first)
userStories.description: Define and document the canonical scenario contract focused on end-product behavior and clearly separate product-seeded fixtures from developer fixture APIs.
acceptanceCriteria: Scenario contract lists end-product workflows: brief, context inventory, memory search, memory timeline, resolve, people memory refresh, planning/agenda/PRD prep.
Each workflow has explicit expected user-facing output signals.
Documentation clearly distinguishes test-data seeded product fixtures from dev fixture API.

userStories.title: Expand test-data corpus for realistic journeys
userStories.description: Build richer fixture corpus with temporal depth, relationship complexity, project threads, and memory variety to support realistic feature validation.
acceptanceCriteria: Corpus includes 6+ people and 12-15 meetings across approximately 10 weeks.
Corpus includes at least 3 project threads and richer decisions/learnings memory entries.
Corpus includes stale/fresh spread sufficient for context inventory stale detection.
TEST-SCENARIOS.md maps prompts to expected outcomes.

userStories.title: Upgrade integration tests to semantic product assertions
userStories.description: Refactor and add integration tests to assert semantic correctness of surfaced intelligence, not only structural existence/counts.
acceptanceCriteria: Existing seeded integration tests verify meaningful content signals (entity/thread/action).
Coverage added for memory search, memory timeline, resolve, people memory refresh, and stale inventory behavior.
Assertions rely on stable semantic markers rather than exact prose matching.

userStories.title: Add shared fixture builder for developer tests
userStories.description: Implement typed shared fixture builder in core tests and migrate selected service tests away from duplicated setup patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: packages/core/test/fixtures includes typed API and rich preset scenario.
Fixture builder has tests for deterministic output and compatibility with core services.
At least 2-3 high-value service tests migrated from ad-hoc setup to shared fixtures.

userStories.title: Support lifecycle-rich project fixtures in seed safely
userStories.description: Update seed fixture copy behavior to support lifecycle project structure while maintaining backward compatibility with existing fixture layout.
acceptanceCriteria: seed test-data supports active/archive project fixture structure.
Seed command tests cover both legacy and lifecycle-rich fixture shapes.

userStories.title: Finalize docs, quality gates, and handoff
userStories.description: Update docs, run mandatory quality gates, and provide a concise manual smoke validation script for end-product workflows.
acceptanceCriteria: Fixture/testing docs updated with canonical scenario and contributor guidance.
npm run typecheck and npm test pass (plus npm run test:py if Python changes exist).
Manual smoke script for end-product workspace validation is provided.
